bug.short_desc: Xorg with nouveau driver dumps core when user logs in
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Since the latest update of xorg-x11-drv-nouveau to version 1.0.14-1 , Xorg crashes with core dump within seconds after a user logs in. This crash seems independent of the user's desktop choice or running applications (I have seen it with Cinnamon, Gnome and KDE). Downgrading to xorg-x11-drv-nouveau-1.0.13-1 fixes this issue, so that is our current workaround.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): xorg-x11-drv-nouveau-1.0.14-1.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. On system with X11 and nouveau driver, install all updates 2. Log in as any user from the display manager 3. X crashes, and the journal mentions a core dump
Actual results:
[root@eendracht ~]# coredumpctl info 801 PID: 801 (Xorg) UID: 0 (root) GID: 0 (root) Signal: 6 (ABRT) Timestamp: Fri 2017-04-21 10:22:00 CEST (1h 3min ago) Command Line: /usr/libexec/Xorg -background none :0 -seat seat0 -auth /var/run/lightdm/root/:0 -nolisten tcp vt1 -novtswitch Executable: /usr/libexec/Xorg Control Group: /system.slice/lightdm.service Unit: lightdm.service Slice: system.slice Boot ID: 1badd6e89f5c4556ab5c6886a7f772d4 Machine ID: 2d9f195cd7864409af92b3316cbad170 Hostname: eendracht.strw.leidenuniv.nl Message: Process 801 (Xorg) of user 0 dumped core.
Stack trace of thread 801: #0 0x00007f07ab7a691f raise (libc.so.6) #1 0x00007f07ab7a851a abort (libc.so.6) #2 0x00000000005a16be OsAbort (Xorg) #3 0x000000000047ba4c ddxGiveUp (Xorg) #4 0x00000000005a7222 AbortServer (Xorg) #5 0x00000000005a802d FatalError (Xorg) #6 0x000000000059e95e OsSigHandler (Xorg) #7 0x00007f07abb485c0 __restore_rt (libpthread.so.0) #8 0x0000000000000024 n/a (n/a)
Additional info: Unfortunately, the coredump doesn't seem to be saved anywhere. Will try to reproduce the issue and create a dump
Problem seems to be solved by upgrading to xorg-x11-drv-nouveau-1:1.0.14-2 Thanks for the quick work!
